data.title: A Law University Interview Template
data.meta_description: Resarch Washington University Law School with our in-depth guide, with past questions and admissions statistics. Improve your application strategy now
data.text:
Motivation and Interest in Law School:

Why law now?

Why WUSTL?

When did you know you wanted to practise law?

How did you get to the point of applying to law school, especially given your experience of practising law in your home country?

What attracted you to the legal profession?

What aspects of Washington University’s law program stand out to you?

Personal Attributes and Qualities:

How do you define success?

Can you tell me about a time that you showed leadership?

What are your thoughts and approaches to leadership and teamwork?

Describe a time your opinion/viewpoint did a 180 on a topic.

How do you handle stress and maintain work-life balance?

Academic Background and GPA:

How did you choose your undergraduate school?

What was your general experience at your UG school/why did you choose it?

What was your favourite class and why?

Do you want to share anything with the admissions committee about your GPA since you redacted it?

How did you get into your undergraduate institution?

Future Plans and Geographic Preferences:

Are you set on moving back to where you live currently, post graduation?

What do you want to do after law school?

Where do your parents live?

What type of law are you interested in practising, and in what region?

Experience with St. Louis and WUSTL Community:

Have you been to St. Louis?

Have you spoken to any current students?

What do you know about the culture and community at Washington University Law School?

How do you plan to contribute to the WUSTL law community?

Additional Information:

You’ve had this amazing career – why do you want to go to law school now?

How old is your son?

What do you do to stay balanced?

Tell me what you’re looking for in a law school experience.

Is there anything not mentioned in your application that you would like the admissions committee to know about you?

Questions for the Interviewer:

What questions do you have for me?

What do you want to know from me?

Can you share your experience as a student or faculty member at Washington University Law School?

What advice would you give to incoming law students at WUSTL to ensure their success?

Ethics and Values:

What does integrity mean to you?

Tell me about an ethical work situation you had to deal with. How did it turn out?

How would you handle a situation where you and your supervisor disagreed about an issue or course of action?

Can you provide an example of when you had to make a difficult ethical decision? How did you resolve it?

How do you ensure you maintain your personal values and ethical standards in your professional life?

Challenges and Overcoming Obstacles:

Tell me about a time you had too many things to do and had to prioritise.

Tell me about a time you had to persuade a colleague to accept your point of view.

Describe a situation where your efforts had a direct impact on the outcome.

Tell us about a time you failed an important goal and what you learned as a result.
